intro: Haemadictyon riedelii, commonly known as the red nettle, is a striking member of the Urticaceae family characterized by its intricate, net-like venation on its leaves. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a deep red or purple coloration, especially when mature. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, Haemadictyon riedelii is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
